title: Carlton Davis gives his pitch for free agents to join Patriots this offseason
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Carlton Davis praised the Patriots and head coach Mike Vrabel to attract free agents this offseason.
The Patriots' Super Bowl appearance and strong roster make them an appealing destination for free agents.
Potential free agency targets for the Patriots include George Pickens, Trey Hendrickson, and Jaelan Phillips.

title: Where does Milton Williams rank among Patriots’ 10 best free-agent signings ever?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Milton Williams ranks eighth among the Patriots' best free-agent signings in history.
Williams signed a four-year, $104 million deal, delivering 5.5 sacks this season.
Williams recorded six quick pressures this postseason, second only to Aaron Donald in history.

title: 8 lesser discussed potential trade deadline candidates that could make sense for Celtics
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics are exploring additions to the roster without major trades before the NBA deadline.
Potential Celtics targets include Nets' Nic Claxton and Mavericks' Daniel Gafford to strengthen at center.
Celtics interested in Kings' guard Keon Ellis, who excels in three-point shooting and defense.

title: Something in the Way Fest 2026: Live updates from Roadrunner
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The Something in the Way festival is held at Boston's Roadrunner on Jan. 31 and Feb. 1 with 24 bands.
Indie and alternative bands like Angel Du$t and Tigers Jaw perform, drawing energetic crowds and engaging performances.
Proceeds from Momma's merchandise sales during the festival support the Immigrant Law Center of Minnesota.

title: Why the Bruins practiced in a tent on Saturday in Florida
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Bruins practiced under a tent at Raymond James Stadium in preparation for an outdoor game.
An air-conditioned structure was erected to maintain ice quality, with temperatures expected to be in the 30s.
The NHL used a refrigerated tent to handle Florida's weather, ensuring ice conditions for the Stadium Series game.

title: Boston ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest must-see moments
author: Annie Jonas and Samantha Genzer
bullets: Thousands rallied in Boston Common for 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest against ICE cooperation with local authorities on Jan. 31, 2026.
The protest was part of a nationwide campaign involving more than 300 cities, inspired by recent deaths due to ICE actions.
Local advocacy groups organized the Boston event, emphasizing nonviolent resistance and pressuring officials for stronger immigrant protections.

title: Photos from Boston’s ‘ICE Out Everywhere’ protest
author: Kelly Chan
bullets: Over a thousand people protested Trump's immigration policies in 15-degree weather at Boston Common.
The 'ICE Out Everywhere' protest was part of a nationwide series organized by Mass 50501 and others.
Protesters gathered at the State House with signs and symbols, such as Dunkin' coffee cup and American flags.

title: Insider believes Red Sox have ‘another move in them’ this offseason to improve infield
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Red Sox still seeking to improve infield as spring training nears; potential targets include Isaac Paredes and Christian Walker.
ESPN's Jeff Passan suggests Red Sox might trade for an infielder despite Cubs' reluctance to trade Nico Hoerner.
Reports indicate Red Sox prioritize defensive infield help; Marcelo Mayer, Romy Gonzalez, and David Hamilton options.

title: Even Drake Maye’s dad is surprised by Patriots’ Super Bowl run
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots surprised many with their Super Bowl run after back-to-back 4-13 seasons.
Quarterback Drake Maye, an MVP candidate, led the league with a 72% completion rate, 8.9 yards per attempt.
Drake Maye's father, Mark, admits the Patriots were fortunate to reach Super Bowl LX after a tough postseason.

title: That guy on TV, Cris Collinsworth, will look familiar to Patriots fans tuning into NBC to watch the Super Bowl
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Cris Collinsworth will call his 53rd Patriots game during Super Bowl LX with Mike Tirico for NBC.
Collinsworth has called five Patriots Super Bowl games, including their previous matchup with the Seahawks 11 seasons ago.
NBC's broadcast team covered three pivotal Patriots games this season, highlighting both offensive and defensive performances.
